item.title: Stocks are skipping the ‘Santa Claus rally’ again this year. That doesn’t bode well for January.
item.description: Santa Claus is leaving investors in the lurch once again in 2024 as U.S. stocks have struggled during the typically bullish home stretch of the year.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield logs sharpest drop in a month to kick off holiday-shortened week
item.description: Bond yields fell sharply ahead of New Year’s Eve, after concerns about sticky inflation had pushed benchmark yields to the highest since late May.

item.title: Natural-gas prices see biggest jump in nearly 3 years, leading oil higher
item.description: Natural-gas prices soared on Monday, tallying their biggest percentage-point gain in nearly three years.

item.title: My mother is giving my son $100K for a down payment. Can she wait until the last minute to put the money in his account?
item.description: “She really doesn’t want to send it to them until they’re ready to make the purchase.”

item.title: My friend has a dependent son, 32, who drives without car insurance. Would his parents be criminally liable if he has an accident?
item.description: “They declare him as a dependent for tax purposes.”
